SUMMARY: An Italian court convicted 91 people for their roles in an organized crime scheme. The scheme led to the theft of five million euros in subsidies from the European Union.

TITLE: Russia expands Ukraine evacuation orders in occupied Kherson
SUMMARY: Russia expanded its evacuation orders in Kherson and claimed the Ukraine is preparing to use a 'prohibited method of war' despite Kyiv's assurances this is false.

TITLE: Brazil Election: Bolsonaro yet to address tense nation, as protesters block roadways
SUMMARY: After an extremely close presidential election, with leftist Lula da Silva defeating incumbent Jair Bolsonaro, a tense nation awaits word of whether Bolsonaro plans to accept the election results.

TITLE: UN committee votes for Israel to dispose of nuclear weapons, allow international inspectors
SUMMARY: The UN General Assembly's First Committee voted overwhelmingly in favor of a resolution calling on Israel to dispose of nuclear weapons and allow international inspectors.

TITLE: India prime minister visits site of bridge collapse as families mourn
SUMMARY: On Tuesday, India's prime minister visited the site of the suspension bridge that collapsed into the Machchu river. This was Asia’s third major disaster involving large crowds in a month.

TITLE: North Korea warns of 'more powerful' response to joint US-South Korea military drills
SUMMARY: The U.S. has expanded its joint military drills with South Korea, which North Korea has declared to be practice for a potential land invasion.

TITLE: China sees spike in COVID-19 cases
SUMMARY: China discovered 2,105 new cases of COVID-19 on Oct. 29, compared to the 1,658 new infections on Oct. 28. There were no reported new deaths.

TITLE: US to send B-52 bombers to Australia in move China warns could 'trigger' arms race
SUMMARY: China is warning an "arms race" may result in response to U.S. plans to send up to six B-52 bombers to Australia to strengthen regional security resources.

TITLE: UK Home secretary faces blowback, calls to step down after calling migrant crisis an 'invasion'
SUMMARY: The UK's Home secretary is facing a growing backlash for what liberal politicians have called "inflammatory language" after she referred to the growing migrant crisis as an "invasion."

TITLE: Greece: Dozens of migrants missing after boat capsizes off coast
SUMMARY: Dozens of migrants were reported missing off an island near Athens after their boat capsized in rough seas, leading Greece's coast guard on a rescue mission.

TITLE: Peace talks regarding Ethiopia's Tigray conflict extended into this week
SUMMARY: Peace talks on Ethiopia's Tigray conflict have been extended into this week. The discussions in South Africa are between Ethiopia's federal government and north Tigray representatives.

TITLE: Macau's spike in COVID cases prompt population testing, lockdown of world's biggest gambling hub
SUMMARY: After China's recent emergence of COVID-19 cases this past week, Macau mass tested its population and authorities locked down a casino resort with 1,500 people ordered to stay inside.

TITLE: Reporter's Notebook: Back to Kyiv as Russia targets city with drones and missile strikes
SUMMARY: Fox News' senior foreign affairs correspondent Greg Palkot returns to Kyiv amid a new flurry of Russian drone and missiles strikes aimed at the city.

TITLE: Israel election: Early exit polls show Netanyahu poised to return to power
SUMMARY: In a decisive election, long-serving former prime minister Benjamin Netanyahu could return to power if exit polls remain the same.

TITLE: Pastor acquitted after being arrested when police helicopter found church gathering outside during pandemic
SUMMARY: A provincial court in Alberta acquitted Pastor Tim Stephens, who was arrested twice on alleged charges of violating provincial public health orders regarding physical distancing.

TITLE: Brazil Election: Bolsonaro addresses nation, pledges fidelity to constitution, calls for end of roadblocks
SUMMARY: After an extremely close presidential election, with leftist Lula da Silva defeating incumbent Jair Bolsonaro, a tense nation awaits word of whether Bolsonaro plans to accept the election results.

TITLE: US military conducting onsite inspections of weapons provided to Ukraine
SUMMARY: U.S. military personnel are conducting inspections to ensure that money and weapons provided to Ukrainian troops is being properly used in Ukraine's fight against Russia.

TITLE: North Korea launches at least 10 missiles; South Korea answers with its own test missiles
SUMMARY: South Korea launched at least three test missiles on Wednesday after North Korea fired off at least 10 missiles. The barrage of fire comes after NoKo threatened to use nuclear weapons.

TITLE: Iran sent more than 3,500 drones to Russia for its war against Ukraine: intel dossier
SUMMARY: Fox News Digital obtained new intelligence from an Iranian opposition group, revealing the increased transfer of Iranian-produced drones to Russia for use in its war against Ukraine.

TITLE: Israel election: Preliminary results show Netanyahu poised to return to power
SUMMARY: In a decisive election, long-serving former prime minister Benjamin Netanyahu could return to power if exit polls remain the same.

TITLE: North Korea launches at least 17 missiles; South Korea answers with its own test missiles
SUMMARY: South Korea launched at least three test missiles on Wednesday after North Korea fired off at least 17 missiles. The barrage of fire comes after NoKo threatened to use nuclear weapons.

TITLE: US to provide Ukraine with two NASAMS in the 'very near future,' six more later: official
SUMMARY: The United States military is seeing through its promise to deliver two advanced missile systems to Ukraine 'in the very near future' ahead of another delivery of six more.

TITLE: North Korea launches at 23 missiles; South Korea answers with its own test missiles
SUMMARY: South Korea launched at least three test missiles on Wednesday after North Korea fired off at least 17 missiles. The barrage of fire comes after NoKo threatened to use nuclear weapons.

TITLE: Russia rejoins Ukraine grain export wartime deal
SUMMARY: Russia agreed to resume its role in exporting grain under the Turkey-UN brokered deal with Ukraine to secure Black Sea shipping lanes.

TITLE: North Korea unleashes biggest 1-day missile barrage; South Korea responds with missile launches
SUMMARY: South Korea launched at least three test missiles on Wednesday after North Korea fired off at least 17 missiles. The barrage of fire comes after NoKo threatened to use nuclear weapons.

TITLE: Danish leader quits in bid to form new Cabinet despite win
SUMMARY: Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen and her Social Democrat government, after winning first place in Denmark's election, chose to step down pin order to build a political coalition.

TITLE: Russia launches rocket with military satellite, UN looks to block space arms race
SUMMARY: Russia launched a Soyuz rocket carrying a military satellite into space as the U.N. looks to stave off a space arms race amid heightened tensions between the U.S. and Russia.

TITLE: Neonatal nurse Lucy Letby allegedly murdered premature baby by forcing air into stomach, jury told
SUMMARY: An expert witness in the trial against alleged killer nurse Lucy Letby said he believes one of her alleged victims was killed by injecting a fatal amount of air into his stomach.

TITLE: UK tightens security over hacking fears from Russia, China
SUMMARY: Liz Truss may have been the victim of a Russian cyberattack while serving as foreign secretary and helped coordinate the British response to Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

TITLE: UK U-turn: PM Sunak will attend UN climate conference at Egyptian resort
SUMMARY: Rishi Sunak, as chancellor of the exchequer in 2021, spoke at the COP26 summit in Glasgow and urged Britain's private sector to increase investment in green initiatives.

TITLE: Lions escape Australia zoo enclosure after issue with containment fence, guests rushed to safety
SUMMARY: Five lions at Australia's Taronga Zoo in Sydney were able to briefly escape their enclosure in an "emergency situation" due to an issue with a containment fence.

TITLE: ICC looks to reopen investigation into crime allegations against Venezuela
SUMMARY: The International Criminal Court is seeking to reopen an investigation into torture and killing allegations committed by the Venezuelan security forces.

TITLE: Netanyahu looks set to return to power in Israel after fifth election
SUMMARY: Israel’s fifth election in four years looks set to return long-serving prime minister Benjamin Netanyahu to power. His Likud party is expected to form a coalition of right-wing and religious parties.

TITLE: Myanmar court finds ex-lawmaker guilty of terrorism, sentenced to 148 years in prison
SUMMARY: An ex-lawmaker from the ousted leader Aung San Suu Kyi’s party was found guilty of terrorism by a Myanmar court. Win Myint Hlaing was sentenced to 148 years.

TITLE: China's strict COVID-19 policies 'indirectly killed' son, father says
SUMMARY: In a case that sparked social media outrage, a father blames China's strict zero-COVID policy for the death of his 3-year-old son, claiming his son died from delay of treatment.

TITLE: Honduras to legalize use of morning-after pill for rape victims
SUMMARY: Honduras will legalize the use of the morning-after pill for rape victims after more than 10 years of total restriction. It is unclear how health officials would verify rape and supply the pill.

TITLE: Bahrain Shiites call on Pope Francis to raise concerns over human rights abuses on trip to Bahrain
SUMMARY: Pope Francis will make the first-ever trip by a pope to Bahrain this week. Activists are calling on the pope to raise concerns about human rights issues on the island.

TITLE: Italian government criticized for decree banning rave parties
SUMMARY: Italy's new interior minister defended the government's decision to ban rave parties. Critics believe the ban could be used to halt sit-ins and other protests.

TITLE: Nobel Prize winners urge world leaders to raise human rights issues at Egypt climate change conference
SUMMARY: World leaders attending the COP27 climate summit in Egypt are being urged to bring up human rights issues, specifically the case of prominent imprisoned activist Abdel-Fattah.

TITLE: Brazil's Bolsonaro tells Supreme Court election 'is over'
SUMMARY: Brazil's Jair Bolsonaro reportedly told Supreme Court members the battle against leftist Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva was over, two days after Bolsonaro's election loss.

TITLE: Paris court will deliver verdict for ex-Liberian rebel case on Wednesday
SUMMARY: An ex-Liberian rebel was charged with torture, acts of barbarism, and complicity in crimes against humanity. A verdict will be delivered in a Paris court on Wednesday.

TITLE: Priest defiant after bishop rebukes him for condemning 'lunatic' transgenderism in homily
SUMMARY: A Roman Catholic priest in Ireland received a public rebuke from his bishop and after he condemned "rampant" sin in society such as ""lunatic" transgenderism"

TITLE: Government inquiry into Australian gay hate killings from the past four decades begins
SUMMARY: A government inquiry has begun in Australia regarding gay hate killings spawning back four decades. The killings happened in New South Wales.

TITLE: North Korea fires missile over Japan, triggering emergency warnings
SUMMARY: North Korea fired a missile that traveled over northern Japan a day after Pyongyang launched at least 23 missiles off its eastern and western coasts.

TITLE: NYC antiquities dealer sentenced to 10 years in prison by Indian court
SUMMARY: From 2011 to 2022, the Manhattan DA's office and HSI have recovered over 2,500 artifacts connected with Kapoor and his network; the value exceeds $143 million.

TITLE: Russia's reinforcements: Where Putin has found more weapons and troops as Ukraine invasion drags on
SUMMARY: Russian President Vladimir Putin has tried to source weapons from North Korea and Iran while hiring mercenaries and fighters from Afghanistan and Syria.

TITLE: North Korea launches ICBM towards Japan day after firing 23 missiles near South Korea; US condemns 'violation'
SUMMARY: North Korea continued to launch missiles on Thursday, drawing condemnation from the U.S. and others. The Japanese government issued evacuation orders because of an ICBM launch.

TITLE: Russia troop morale low over fighting in tin 'cans' as Moscow leans on Belarus for support
SUMMARY: Low morale in Russia's ranks continues as troops remain rankled over fighting in tin 'cans' while Moscow continues to see massive equipment losses.

TITLE: Burma court finds ex-lawmaker guilty of terrorism, sentenced to 148 years in prison
SUMMARY: An ex-lawmaker from the ousted leader Aung San Suu Kyi’s party was found guilty of terrorism by a Burma court. Win Myint Hlaing was sentenced to 148 years.

TITLE: US, South Korea extend air force drills after North Korea fires ICMB
SUMMARY: The U.S. and South Korea will continue their joint air force drills this weekend after North Korea fired a trio of missiles. One was an ICBM that may have failed in flight.

TITLE: Former Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan wounded in gun attack: official
SUMMARY: Pakistani officials state that a gunman opened fire at a truck carrying former Prime Minister Imran Khan, the gunman injured both Khan and his political supporters.

TITLE: Israeli PM Lapid concedes election to Netanyahu
SUMMARY: Benjamin Netanyahu appears set to be the next Prime Minister of Israel, as current leader Yair Lapid has already conceded the election and called to congratulate him.

TITLE: US, South Korea threaten to 'end' Kim regime if North Korea uses nuclear weapon
SUMMARY: Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin warned that the U.S. and South Korea will dismantle North Korean dictator Kim Jong Un's regime if he resorts to using nuclear weapons.

TITLE: US, South Korea extend air force drills after North Korea fires ICBM
SUMMARY: The U.S. and South Korea will continue their joint air force drills this weekend after North Korea fired a trio of missiles. One was an ICBM that may have failed in flight.

TITLE: Netanyahu victory in Israeli election presents 'stark challenge' for US Middle East policy
SUMMARY: Benjamin Netanyahu will assume power following a close election that saw him working with the far-right party of Itamar Ben-Gvir, which has prompted concern from some on the left.

TITLE: Disturbing video shows Iran’s police brutally beating anti-regime protestor
SUMMARY: Iran’s police mowed down a helpless protestor with a motorcycle, live ammunition and beatings while the death toll of Iranians demonstrators killed by the regime reached at least 277 protestors as of Wednesday.

TITLE: Disturbing video shows Iran’s police brutally beating anti-regime protester
SUMMARY: Iran’s police mowed down a helpless protester with a motorcycle, live ammunition and beatings while the death toll of Iranians demonstrators killed by the regime reached at least 277 protestors as of Wednesday.

TITLE: South Korea scrambles jets as North Korea launches 180 flights on border
SUMMARY: South Korea scrambled 80 jets Friday after it detected some 180 military jets near the shared border with North Korea.

TITLE: Former Pakistan Prime Minister Khan stable after shooting
SUMMARY: Pakistan's former Prime Minister Imran Khan was shot Thursday during a protest march, according to senior leaders from Khan's party, Imran Khan is now in stable condition.

TITLE: China's Xi urges Ukraine peace talks with Germany's Scholz
SUMMARY: Newly re-elected Chinese President Xi Jinping has called for peace talks over Ukraine and warned against the escalation of the war in a meeting with German Chancellor Olaf Scholz

TITLE: G7 takes aim at chief adversaries and urges peace from UN leaders Russia, China
SUMMARY: Chief diplomats from the Group of 7 rallied together in a joint address to condemn increasingly threatening activities by global adversaries like Russia, China, North Korea and Iran.

TITLE: North Korea fires 4 more ballistic missiles as US, South Korea end drills
SUMMARY: North Korea fired four more short-range ballistic missiles as the U.S. and South Korea wrap up joint military drills.

TITLE: Peru pollution protest: 10 Americans on tourist riverboat held hostage, released
SUMMARY: At least 10 Americans held hostage this week in Peru have been released after tourists became embroiled in an action by indigenous groups to stop oil spills.

TITLE: Taiwan scrambles jets, missile systems after detecting 11 Chinese aircraft, vessels near island
SUMMARY: Taiwan on Saturday said it had scrambled jets, naval responses and missile systems after it detected 11 Chinese aircraft and vessels off the island.

TITLE: Climate activists glue hands to Goya paintings in Spain's Prado Museum
SUMMARY: Climate activists in Spain glued their hands to two famous paintings by artist Francisco de Goya in Madrid's Prado museum. Police said two people were arrested.

TITLE: Spanish Civil Guard seizes 'largest stash of marijuana discovered'
SUMMARY: The Spanish Civil Guard reported having seized the "largest stash of marijuana discovered" through raids across the country, seizing more than 32,370 kilograms of marijuana.

TITLE: High-ranking Church of England officials endorse gay marriage: 'Rank heresy'
SUMMARY: Multiple bishops in the Church of England, including the high-ranking Bishop of Oxford Steven Croft, affirmed gay marriage and called on the institution to bless such unions.
